tit.e: Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the lord of the domain of Tsuchiura)
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the lord of Tsuchiura Domain)
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the lord of Tsuchiura Domain)

sen.j: 朽木 稙綱（くつき たねつな、慶長10年（1605年） - 万治3年12月13日 (旧暦)（1661年1月13日））は、江戸時代前期の大名。
sen.e: Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1605 - January 13, 1661) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1605 - January 13, 1661) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1605 - January 13, 1661) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
He was the Load of Kutsuki domain in Omi Province.
He was the lord of Kutsuki Domain in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字にしました。lordスペル訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the lord of Kutsuki Domain in Omi Province.

sen.j: 下野国鹿沼藩主、常陸国土浦藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the Load of Kanuma domain in Shimotsuke Province and the first Load of Tsuchiura domain in Hitachi Province.
He was the lord of Kanuma Domain in Shimotsuke Province and the first Lord of Tsuchiura Domain in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字にしました。lordスペル訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the lord of Kanuma Domain in Shimotsuke Province and the first Lord of Tsuchiura Domain in Hitachi Province.
He was the first load of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama domain.
He was the first lord of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama Domain.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字にしました。lordスペル訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the first lord of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama Domain.
He was the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI.
He was the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI.
He was the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI.
He was a younger brother of Nobutsuna KUTSUKI.
He was a younger brother of Nobutsuna KUTSUKI.
He was a younger brother of Nobutsuna KUTSUKI.

sen.j: 正室は稲葉正成の娘、継室は安藤重長の養女（志水忠宗の娘）。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanari INABA, and his second wife was an adopted daughter of Shigenaga ANDO (daughter of Tadamune SHIMIZU).
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanari INABA, and his second wife was an adopted daughter of Shigenaga ANDO (daughter of Tadamune SHIMIZU).
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masanari INABA, and his second wife was an adopted daughter of Shigenaga ANDO (daughter of Tadamune SHIMIZU).

sen.j: 子に朽木稙昌（長男）、朽木則綱（次男）、娘（三浦安次正室）、娘（内藤政親正室）、娘（木下俊長正室）。
sen.e: His children included Tanemasa KUTSUKI (oldest son), Noritsuna KUTSUKI (second son), a daughter (lawful wife of Yasutsugu MIURA), and a daughter (lawful wife of Toshinaga KINOSHITA).
His children included Tanemasa KUTSUKI (oldest son), Noritsuna KUTSUKI (second son), a daughter (lawful wife of Yasutsugu MIURA), and a daughter (lawful wife of Toshinaga KINOSHITA).
His children included Tanemasa KUTSUKI (oldest son), Noritsuna KUTSUKI (second son), a daughter (lawful wife of Yasutsugu MIURA), and a daughter (lawful wife of Toshinaga KINOSHITA).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、民部少輔。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 元和 (日本)4年（1618年）9月11日、3代将軍徳川家光に仕え始める。
sen.e: On October 25, 1618, he started to serve Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun.
On October 29, 1618, he started to serve Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun.
sen.cmt: 日付グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: On October 29, 1618, he started to serve Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun.

sen.j: 元和9年（1623年）に民部少輔に叙任された。
sen.e: He was appointed to Minbu shoyu in 1623.
He was appointed to Minbu shoyu in 1623.
He was appointed to Minbu shoyu in 1623.

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）5月21日には小姓組番頭に任命され、翌々年の寛永10年（1633年）の7月24日には、書院番頭となった。
sen.e: On June 20, 1631, he was appointed to the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun, and two years later, on August 28, 1633, he became the chief of military patrol.
On June 20, 1631, he was appointed to the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun, and two years later, on August 28, 1633, he became the chief of military patrol.
On June 20, 1631, he was appointed to the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun, and two years later, on August 28, 1633, he became the chief of military patrol.

sen.j: 寛永12年（1635年）11月20日、再び小姓組番頭となり、若年寄を兼任した。
sen.e: On December 29, 1635, he became chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun again and also served as wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).
On December 29, 1635, he became chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun again and also served as wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).
On December 29, 1635, he became chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun again and also served as wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).

sen.j: 寛永13年（1636年）に加増を受けて1万石の大名となり近江朽木藩を創設した。
sen.e: In 1636, he gained additional properties to become daimyo with 10000 koku, and founded Omi Kutsuki Domain.
In 1636, he gained additional properties to become daimyo with 10000 koku, and founded Omi Kutsuki Domain.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1636, he gained additional properties to become daimyo with 10000 koku, and founded Omi Kutsuki Domain.

sen.j: その後、寛永16年（1639年）9月4日に1万石の加増を受け、正保4年（1647年）12月14日に更に5千石の加増を受けて下野鹿沼藩主となる。
sen.e: After that, he gained 10000 koku of additional properties on September 30, 1639, gained 5000 more koku on January 8, 1648, and became the lord of the Shimotsuke Kanuma domain.
After that, he gained 10000 koku of additional properties on September 30, 1639, gained 5000 more koku on January 8, 1648, and became the lord of the Shimotsuke Kanuma Domain.
After that, he gained 10000 koku of additional properties on September 30, 1639, gained 5000 more koku on January 8, 1648, and became the lord of the Shimotsuke Kanuma Domain.

sen.j: 慶安2年（1649年）2月19日に若年寄を免ぜられ、3万石をもって常陸土浦藩に転封。
sen.e: On March 31, 1649, he was excused from wakadoshiyori, gained 30000 koku, and changed the territory to Hitachi Tsuchiura Domain.
On March 31, 1649, he was excused from wakadoshiyori, gained 30000 koku, and changed the territory to Hitachi Tsuchiura Domain.
On March 31, 1649, he was excused from wakadoshiyori, gained 30000 koku, and changed the territory to Hitachi Tsuchiura Domain.

sen.j: 承応元年（1652年）11月1日、奏者番に任ぜられた。
sen.e: On December 1, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies).
On December 1, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies).
On December 1, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies).
